org.dkpro.core.api.frequency.util

Class ConditionalFrequencyDistribution<C,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dkpro.core.api.frequency.util.ConditionalFrequencyDistribution<C,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the type of the conditions
    V - the type of the samples

    public class ConditionalFrequencyDistribution<C,V>
extends Object
    Inspired by nltk.probability.ConditionalFreqDist Maps a condition to a FrequencyDistribution.

    This class could be used to learn how frequently a word collocates with another word. Suppose we want to know how frequently the word "of" appears after the word "because", then ConditionalFrequencyDistribution can be used as follows:

     ConditionalFrequencyDistribution<String, String> cfd =
     new ConditionalFrequencyDistribution<String, String>();

 cfd.addSample("because", "in");
 cfd.addSample("because", "of");
 cfd.addSample("despite", "in");
 cfd.addSample("because", "of");

 System.out.println(cfd.getCount("despite", "of"));

    The last call to getCount(C, V) will yield 2, because given the condition that the first word in a two-word sequence is "because", the word "of" has appeared twice.

    This class was inspired by NLTK's FreqDist.

    See Also:
    FrequencyDistribution

      • getN

        public long getN()
        Returns:
        The total number of sample outcomes that have been recorded by this ConditionalFreqDist.

      • getCount

        public long getCount(C condition,
                     V sample)
        Returns the total number of samples which equal a given sample under a given condition.

        If there are no samples for the condition in question on record, 0 will be returned.

        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        sample - the sample under a given condition
        Returns:
        the number of all samples which equal sample

      • getFrequencyDistribution

        public FrequencyDistribution<V> getFrequencyDistribution(C condition)
        Returns the FrequencyDistribution under a given condition, or null if this distribution contains no such FrequencyDistribution for this condition.
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        Returns:
        the distribution the condition maps to

      • incAll

        public void incAll(C condition,
                   Iterable<V> samples)
        Increases all provided samples under a given condition.

        If there is no FrequencyDistribution present for the given condition, a new empty one will be created and populated from the given samples.

        Parameters:
        condition - the condition for the samples
        samples - the samples to add
